Medical professionals will turn to the most likely cause of a problem; a wry neck is a far, far more likely explanation for her pain than actually managing to dislocate two vertebrae, and the symptoms she was showing were hardly unusual for such a diagnosis. Furthermore, they sent her right Off to the spinal trauma clinic the second they realised her arm was Tingling, whereupon they needed an X-ray and a specialist's consultation before they realised what exactly was wrong.Â
Sure, you could argue that they should have given her that X-ray earlier, but considering they had a perfectly good diagnosis already it would have been seen as superfluous and a waste of government money.
